image.altText: A search and rescue aircraft.

props.synopsis: Police say the "experienced" male pilot was flying his female passenger in a plane he purchased "three to four months ago".

title.children: 'Experienced' male pilot, female passenger missing over Bass Strait

image.altText: George Razay with a saxophone.

props.synopsis: Dementia specialist, tap dancer, saxophonist, author, city councillor, veteran doctor, professor — George Razay has quite the resume. Now, he has added Tasmanian Member of Parliament to the list. Who is he, and what does he stand for?

title.children: Who is George Razay, sax playing doctor, opponent of Hobart stadium and new Bass MP?

image.altText: Composite image Jeremy Rockliff and Dean Winter.

props.synopsis: While the Liberals and Labor play their power games, Tasmania's parliament is paused; no legislation is being passed and the state is effectively left on standby — with the make-up the same as before the election.

title.children: Vote counting done, the deal-making begins for Tasmania's next government

image.altText: Minecraft graphic of an adult and child seated beside each other

props.synopsis: Rather than battling over device time with children, one clinical psychologist is recommending "meeting children where they are" as a first step to fostering family conversations, and even letting kids self-regulate their use.

title.children: How scrapping strict screen time limits helped families connect offline

image.altText: the hands of an elderly person scoop out ice cream in a small tub

props.synopsis: You won't find this ice cream at a cafe or supermarket. The nutrient-dense, high-protein ice cream is designed to help with unintended weight loss of people in palliative care.

title.children: Medicinal ice cream supporting palliative care patients, one scoop at a time

image.altText: A man with grey hair and glasses stands on a waterfront

props.synopsis: In October 1973, Mick Doleman joined the crew of the Blythe Star for a two-night voyage towards King Island off the north-west coast of Tasmania. That trip would change everyone's lives forever.

title.children: LISTEN: Blythe Star shipwreck survivor speaks

image.altText: Dr Mo in the Kimberley

props.synopsis: Mohammed 'Dr Mo' Mustafa might only be a junior doctor from Perth, but he's got the ear of leaders from around the world as he tries to turn his dream of a children's hospital in Gaza into reality.

title.children: After seeing the horrors in Gaza, Dr Mo embarked on a near-impossible mission

image.altText: Two women crying and mourning in an outside garden

props.synopsis: The Palestinian Red Crescent Society says one staffer is dead after an Israeli strike on its headquarters in the Gaza city of Khan Younis.

title.children: More starvation deaths reported in Gaza as Israel hits Red Crescent HQ

image.altText: CCTV footage of a store alight

props.synopsis: We can now conclude that the strategy of taxing and banning nicotine addiction out of existence is a complete failure. The result is organised crime making about $10 billion a year in revenue.

title.children: Australia's illegal tobacco problem has jumped from tragedy to farce

image.altText: A TV still of Kitty Flanagan sitting at a desk, wearing glasses and a loose brown suit. She has a bemused expression.

props.synopsis: Lynne McGranger has won the Gold Logie for 2025, with ABC comedy Fisk taking home the most awards for the night. Here is the complete list of 2025 Logies winners.

title.children: Logies 2025 winners list: Lynne McGranger wins gold, Fisk sweeps comedy categories

image.altText: Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris congratulate each other

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri has been denied another F1 win this season by less than one second, as his teammate Lando Norris pulled off a terrific strategy to win the Hungarian Grand Prix.

title.children: Lando Norris holds on to beat Oscar Piastri by 0.698 seconds in Hungary

image.altText: Navy recruits celebrating their graduation

props.synopsis: Targeted advertising on social media and in online games has helped deliver a boost to Australian Defence Force recruitment, offsetting a perennial problem of declining service rates.

title.children: TikTok and online games deliver military recruitment surge

image.altText: Backo hospital melioidosis

props.synopsis: Sam Backo has died after a three-month battle with tropical soil disease melioidosis and complications related to an ongoing heart condition.

title.children: Rugby league great Sam Backo dies in hospital after battle with melioidosis

image.altText: Robert Irwin leans against a 4WD on the beach

props.synopsis: Tourism Australia will splash out on a $130 million international campaign to lure visitors to the country, with Robert Irwin front and centre.

title.children: Robert Irwin the face of new Tourism Australia marketing campaign

image.altText: figures wearing hoodies and one holding a gun near a car

props.synopsis: Police release confronting images which they allege show a man being kidnapped at gunpoint. The 52-year-old died days later from his injuries.

title.children: Five charged over kidnapping, murder of 52yo in Brisbane

image.altText: An old dark skinned man wearing a red headband frowns

props.synopsis: Warlpiri elder Ned Jampijinpa Hargraves joins growing calls for federal intervention into law and justice policies in the Northern Territory.

title.children: 'We've had enough': Warlpiri elder issues plea to prime minister

image.altText: Large old pub with verandahs on the corner. Snow is falling.

props.synopsis: Stranded motorists are bedding down on a pub floor for a second night as snow remains on the Northern Tablelands. while thousands of residents remain without power.

title.children: People sleep on pub floor waiting for NSW's wild weather to end

image.altText: Portrait of Yoorrook Commissioner Sue-Anne Hunter

props.synopsis: Adjunct Professor Sue-Anne Hunter, a Wurundjeri and Ngurai Illum Wurrung woman, will start in the role later this year.

title.children: New national commissioner appointed amid worsening outcomes for Indigenous children

image.altText: GettyImages-2228303107

props.synopsis: Fremantle stay in the hunt for a top four finish with comeback win over Carlton, however, the victory was soured with star's fresh injury.

title.children: Dockers' crucial win soured by star's fresh injury

image.altText: A curator at the Australian War Memorial displaying the old bottle of beer.

props.synopsis: When best mates Stanley Lewis and Frederick Hume enlisted to serve in World War II, a publican in the NSW town of Wingham gave them a gift they would never be able enjoy together.

title.children: Two mates made a pact about this bottle of beer. It's still unopened

image.altText: Melting ice cream cone with US flag in the background and two sticks with Donald Trump's head with US flag sunglasses stuck in

props.synopsis: Returning to the US for the first time in four years, I found a country that didn't want to talk about politics, despite being in the eye of the Trump storm.

title.children: Trump's presidency is becoming one of the most consequential in decades

image.altText: A dump truck emptying a pile of red dirt into a very large mine - there are hills in the background.

props.synopsis: The Productivity Commission says we should hike taxes on oligopolies and cut taxes on small businesses if we want the economy to flourish.

title.children: Hit oligopolies, cut tax on businesses and watch Australia's economy grow

image.altText: Jye is wearing a bright yellow t-shirt and is jumping off the jetty onto the sand.

props.synopsis: Sand surrounds the jetty in the small beachside community of Port Gregory on WA's Mid West coast and locals are calling on the government to intervene.

title.children: People once fished off this jetty. Now there's nothing but sand

image.altText: A close up of Sally McManus in the Insiders studio.

props.synopsis: ACTU Secretary Sally McManus says it's time to "bite the bullet" and reform negative gearing and the capital gains tax to make it easier for young people to enter the housing market.

title.children: Union boss calls for one property limit on negative gearing tax breaks

image.altText: A doctor wraps a tape measure around a child's skeletal arm. The circumference is in the "red" category for acute malnutrition.

props.synopsis: Doctors and aid workers say the world's concern over the aid blockade in Gaza has come too late. Many of the children you've read about probably can't be saved.

title.children: The red part of this tape represents a point from which children can't return

image.altText: Compilation of photos of men posing for camera with prominent photo of Richard Fidler in suit

props.synopsis: As a child, Richard Fidler was endlessly curious. That same thirst for understanding has guided him behind the Conversations mic, gently drawing captivating stories from his guests.

title.children: What Richard Fidler has learnt from two decades of Conversations

image.altText: A woman in a black long-sleeved surf rashie with a blue boogie board under her arm at the beach.

props.synopsis: From Granny Grommets shredding waves on the Gold Coast to Fitzroy Fossils rowing their way into retirement, these ageing Aussies prove it's never too late to start fitness and fun.

title.children: Secret to ageing well for these Aussies is 'wearing out' not 'rusting out'

image.altText: A list of "Interactive Sex" games and incest titles, in red and strikethrough to indicate they've been removed.

props.synopsis: Thousands of adult video games were pulled from digital storefronts this month after Australian campaign group Collective Shout pressured payment companies including PayPal, Visa and Mastercard.

title.children: An online campaign sparked mass NSFW game takedowns. Then the backlash began

image.altText: Here's Leonardo Puglisi setting up to anchor the 6 News Sunday night bulletin.

props.synopsis: Australian teenagers have grown up on YouTube and admit it can be harmful, but some say the government's blanket ban will do little to address the problems.

title.children: Australian teens reflect on losing YouTube, a gen Z cultural fixture

image.altText: Image shows an elderly Japanese woman standing in front of a stove in a kitchen

props.synopsis: In Japan, you can rent a grandmother to help cook for you and give you support. What do services like this mean for Japan’s aging population, especially for women?

title.children: Elderly women in Japan are keeping themselves employed as grandmas-for-hire

image.altText: A portait of Denise Bowden.

props.synopsis: Pressure is building on the federal government to remove funding from the Northern Territory government unless it meets outcomes on Indigenous incarceration.

title.children: 'No blank cheques': Pressure on federal government to pull territory funding

image.altText: Alexei Popyrin clenches his fist in celebration during a match

props.synopsis: Alexei Popyrin has staged another great escape to make the quarterfinals of the Canadian Open, where he is looking to defend last year's title.

title.children: Popyrin sets up Zverev showdown in bid to defend Canadian Open crown

image.altText: A newborn baby is shown lying down, with one of its feet in the foreground of the image.

props.synopsis: The Queensland coroner describes the case of a baby — known to child safety authorities — who starved to death while his mother and her partner were on a drug binge as "utterly tragic".

title.children: Eight-month-old baby dies while mother and partner on drug binge

image.altText: Close-up of part of a grey and white air purifier.

props.synopsis: Even air purifiers with the best filters vary in how well they clear your home of smoke. Here's what to look for in a unit, and how to make the most of it.

title.children: Wood smoke can harm your health. Can an air purifier protect you?

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera seated in a garden

props.synopsis: For most people, a package delivered to their homes is usually welcomed but for people experiencing domestic violence, alcohol delivery is "like the guided missile that is the match".

title.children: Former Neighbours star urges changes to alcohol delivery laws
